_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Shield packaging in the bussiness of manufacturing aerosol and liquid products.We are a contract packager.We
receive flammable gas as a propane mixture by tank truck. Our largest tank has a 6800 gallon capacity.Our policity is not to fill
any tank more than 85% full. We also receive flammable liquids by tank truck.Our entire property is enclosed with a fence
We have CAL OSHA PRESSURE VESSEL DIVISION approved unloading manifolds. We have permits for all our tanks,which 
are issued by the same agency.All tanks,pumps,piping, fittingsand valves are installed and maintained following NFPA-58
requirements and maintainedunder natioal LP GAS Association guide lines. All installations have been approved by local fire
department.The fire department does a walk through of the entire facility every so often.This will prepare them in the event of 
an emergency response. The fire station is less than a half mile away.                                   
             We have written procedures for unloading chemicals and gases.All bulk liquid chemicals are stored in diked containment areas.These containment areas have manual drain valves.All valves on all tanks are closed when not in use.We have a preventive maintaintaince program that insures that our tanks and handling equipment remain in safe working condition. Shield employees are well trained to do their particular job task.
             We hold periodic fire and emergency drills. An evacuation route has been posted. In the event of an emergency, certain employees have pre-assigned have duites.  Once the evacuation alarm is sounded, all other employees will remain in the designated evaccuation area until instructed to return to their work stations by the plant manager.  If a discharge cannot be controlled, or in the event of a fire, the fire department will be summoned immediately and all other required ageencys will be notified.  If necessary, we have made arrangements with an outside contractor to help us with a

release.
             Our worst case scenario would be a vapor cloud explosion, resulting from a tank rupture due to overfilling and equipment failure.  These tanks are equipped with an excess flow valve and pressure relief valve.  We have maintenance procedures that will prevent corrosion.  This policy limits our inventory to 85% of the tank capacity.  Our alternative release scenario would be a one inch pipe break, resulting in a vapor cloud fire.
             We have excess flow and check valves in lines, as well as manual and automatic shut off valves. No accidental releases have occurred at our facility. No immediate plan changes are necessary at this time to improve safety.
             Our policy is that the event of either of these scenarios taking place, we would not attempt to control the situation.  The local fire department has been informed that they would summoned immediately as a first responder.
